Add a personal\ninhaler
1. Hold the inhaler behind your mobile\ndevice, so you see the inhaler\'s QR\ncode on the mobile device screen.
2. Align the inhaler\'s QR code with the yellow square on the screen.
QR Code
1. Hold the inhaler behind your mobile\ndevice, so you see the inhaler\'s QR\ncode on the mobile device screen.
2. Align the inhaler\'s QR code with the\nyellow square on the screen.

Teva Support
Customer Support can help you get started and answer your questions about the use of $TradeName$.
Customer Support
About
Welcome to your\npersonal ProAir\nDigihaler App This app can be used with your\nProAir Digihaler.
Only use this app for your personal inhaler(s).
Your ProAir Digihaler is always ready for immediate use.\n\nA connection to the app is not needed for you to take your medicine.
This widget shows the number of inhalation events today.\n\nYou will receive feedback\nshortly after you inhale and close the red cap.\n\nReports are available to track your ProAir Digihaler use. Use this widget to see your reports.
A red widget circle will notify you to check the dose counter of your registered inhaler(s) for a possible refill.\n\nUse the widget to manage your registered inhalers.
Real time Air Quality, Weather\nand Pollen information is\navailable for your location.
Use this icon for your Daily Self Assessment.\n\nSelect an option based on how you feel.
Customer Support is only 1 click away to answer your questions or help you get started with your ProAir Digihaler and app.
We recommend setting a password on your mobile device to protect your personal information stored in the app.
Use this icon to generate your User Report.
Let\'s get started!

Daily self assessment:
Green Zone: Usual cough, wheeze, chest tightness or shortness of breath during\nthe day or night; Can do usual activities
Yellow Zone: More cough, wheeze, chest tightness or increased shortness of\nbreath or more waking at night due to respiratory symptoms or can do some but\nnot all usual activities
Red Zone: Very short of breath or Quick Relief medicines have not helped or\ncannot do usual activities or symptoms are same or worse after 24 hours in Yellow

Make sure to bring your inhaler(s) within range of your mobile device on a regular basis to capture your inhalation events in the App.
$TradeName$ $Name$ is now connected\n\nYour inhalation events will be captured in the App any time your $TradeName$ is connected.\n\nMake sure to bring your inhaler(s) within range of your mobile device on a regular basis and enable Bluetooth.
$TradeName$ (\'$Name$\') is connected.
Your inhalation events will be captured in the app any time your ProAir Digihaler is connected.\n\n Make sure to bring your inhaler(s) within range of your mobile device on a regular basis and enable Bluetooth.\n\n Check the connection status in the My Inhaler Widget.
Good Inhalation Detected
Tip: Always breathe in as quickly and deeply as possible.
No Inhalation Detected Remember to breathe in quickly and deeply. Review the instructions for use.\n\nTip: Take another inhalation if you need it.
Make sure to not cover the air vent when you inhale.\n\nTip: Take another inhalation if you need it.
Make sure to not cover the air vent when you inhale.
Tip: Take another inhalation if you need it.
Exhalation Detected Be careful not to breathe into the inhaler. Review the instructions for use.\n\nTip: Take another inhalation if you need it.
It seems you have some difficulties using $TradeName$
Contact your healthcare professional or Customer Support for advice, and review the Instructions For Use.
System Error Detected (Code $SystemErrorCode$)
No data available. Contact Customer Support for advice.
Always close the red cap after\neach inhalation so your inhaler\nwill be ready for you to take\nyour next inhalation and\ntrack your information

Allow $AppName$ to access your device\'s location to connect your inhaler to the app and to enable the real time Air Quality, Weather, and Pollen information in your (US) location
$TradeName$\nUser Report
Green Zone: Usual cough, wheeze, chest tightness or shortness of breath\nduring the day or night; Can do usual activities
Yellow Zone: More cough, wheeze, chest tightness or increased shortness\nof breath or more waking at night due to respiratory symptoms or can do\nsome but not all usual activities
Red Zone: Very short of breath or Quick Relief medicines have not helped\nor cannot do usual activities or symptoms are same or worse after\n24 hours in Yellow
Your ProAir Digihaler®
Your ProAir Digihaler® allows you to take a more active role in controlling your asthma, while allowing better communication with your doctor.
Your Health
This app automatically tracks your medication usage and inhalation technique, environment, and daily self-assessment, creating a comprehensive view of your asthma.
Your Control
When it’s time for your next doctor’s appointment, this information can be used by you and your doctor to develop a personalized plan for managing your asthma.
Let\'s Get Started

You have requested to share your data with %s provided by %s (\“the Program\”).\n\nBy clicking \“Share My Data\” below, you consent to Teva sharing with the Program (i) the data collected by this app and (ii) the data collected by any of Teva\’s other connected respiratory apps that you use (whether offered now or in future).\n\nPlease contact the Program directly if you have any questions about how it plans to use your data. You can stop sharing data with the Program at any time by leaving the Program.
